page.title: 16Stalyhill from Shaw Moor.
page.content: Walking from Shuuts Lane recently tarmaced by the Water Board, the land on our right is covered by modern brick houses built in the last 11 years. On the left is rough grazing land with horses and cattle. The farms are stone built of the late 18th century. At Ashton Hill Cross, the ancient Roman road cuts across. Shaw Moor & Hobson Moor are important watershedding for local water supply. Land changes near Shaw Moor farm to heathermoorland and whimberry. Grouse, Martins and Swifts flew over. We found an Emperor moth. Pylons buzzed overhead. At Trig point (399m) we had magnificient view of Copley School,Stalybridge Celtic Football Club, Eastwood(RSPB), Hyde Finefare, Jodrell Bank Telescope and Walkerwood and Millbrook reservoirs.
